snippet: Residents of poor neighborhoods are less likely than those in wealthier ones to enroll in free online courses, a study finds.
abstract: Dr John D Hansen study in journal Science reports people living in more affluent neighborhoods are more likely to take advantage of free online educational courses, suggesting such classes are not as democratic as hoped.
lead_paragraph: Residents of poor neighborhoods are less likely than those in wealthier ones to enroll in free online courses, a study finds.

headline.print_headline: Education: A Class Divide in Online Courses
headline.main: Online Classes Appeal More to the Affluent
